author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Union Government is setting up garment units in the States in north east India, said Union Minister of State for Textiles Santosh Kumar Gangwar here on Thursday.

He was speaking at a meeting organised by Indian Texpreneurs Federation on “Make in India – Textile Industry”.

Garment unit

The Minister said the Government was setting up a garment unit in each State in the north east at an investment of nearly Rs. 18 crore for a unit. These would be inaugurated by the Prime Minister shortly, may be in a month.

Textiles share in manufacturing was improving and efforts were on to improve exports. The sector occupied central position in the Make in India initiative.

The government had allowed 100 per cent foreign direct investment in textiles. India had 24 per cent of the global spindle capacity. There was no shortage of raw material and there was world class infrastructure.

These made India an important player in the global market.

The share of developing nations in the global textile market was increasing. Countries such as Cambodia, Vietnam, Pakistan and Bangladesh were making their mark in the global market.

The government had provided three per cent interest subvention, benefits under Merchandise Exports from India scheme, and recently approved 22 new parks taking the total number of parks under the Scheme for Integrated Textile Parks to 72.

These efforts and the amended TUFS would incentivise textile industry and boost Make in India initiative, he said.
title: Efforts on to increase textile exports
